Well my procedure is on hold due to fact I’ve been tested POSITIVE for COVID. 😷🤧🤒😥
Not leaving till next week sometime it seems. More tests are involved. Checking my heart out good. It’s been broken so many times maybe it’s tired. 😢

They have me on strong diuretic to lose all that extra water gain. It’s causing problems to the right side of my heart. 😢They are doing everything they can so it doesn’t have to work so hard. The fluid is slowly killing my heart. Scared still but know I’m in good hands🤲🏻

Pulmonary hypertension....
Brought on by meds and all the stuff they did to my heart plus severe water retention. Doing a groin catheter test thing Monday. 
Also working with my therapist/Dr to rework my bipolar meds.

I suggest grief counseling if you feel you can open up to a group. 
I chose not to. I am bipolar and have my regular therapists. They walked me through every step. Even if I needed to talk in middle of night, I had someone on my list to call. 

It’s out there. Free of charge too

2/2
These steps don’t go in order and there is no time limits on how to work through each step. 

Don’t allow others to tell you that you’ve grieved long enough or to ‘get over it’.  I heard both after the loss of my son. 

I have chosen to grieve my way. 

I hope you do too.

I wish to address something few  don’t like talking about. 
Grief: It comes in many ways and as humans we try to deal with it by sometimes not what’s conducive to our own mental health. 

There are 5 basic steps:
Denial
Anger
Bargaining
Depression
Acceptance
1/1 #GriefCounseling

4/4
Squeezing hard. Then as quickly as the smell came, it dissipated. 
The kicker..... it lasted 2 hours and it felt like 20 minutes. Somehow we lost time too. 🤷🏼‍♀️ 
I know this sounds like a made up story but my heart is beating a mile a minute just talking about it...

3/3 was watching us. The smell was so strong...🥴 He grabbed an ax I had a walking stick. lol We were scared to turn on the flashlight. That it might charge us. We both knew something was there, watching. Then we heard a huge branch break. I grabbed my son’s hand...

No sounds at all... the creek we couldn’t even hear & it was only 25 ft away. The smell was omg nauseating. Not a skunk or bear...it also had an earthy smell mixed in. The hair stood up all over me & Dustin too. Whispering he said he felt like someone/something ....2/2

It’s nightmarish to say goodbye
As tears are streaming from your eyes
Whether they have died or gone elsewhere
Its to difficult to bear
Knowing they won’t be there

She asked for life
He gave her guilted 
Cement shoes
Throwing her in despair
Drowning her
As she floundered
In shame and guilt
Poisoning her mind
Splitting her in half 
Each breath she took
Was filled with 
His cyanide utterances
Causing her untold pain
#partone #poem
